checkmate.logic.game

Class ChessGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • checkmate.logic.game.ChessGame

  • public class ChessGame
extends Object
    Main class for game logic.
    Author:
    llmlks

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ChessGame()
      Constructor calls own method initGame().

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void castle(Square s)
      Handles castling when king is moved two squares to square s.
      void enPassant(Piece pawn, Square to, Square from)
      Helper function to determine when en passant is possible.
      Square findSquareByCoordinates(int x, int y)
      Finds square at coordinates x and y.
      ChessBoard getBoard()
      Returns private variable board.
      boolean getEnded()
      Returns boolean value for whether the game is finished.
      Player[] getPlayers()
      Returns list of players.
      String getTurn()
      Returns the String colour of the player whose turn it is.
      Validator getValidator()
      Returns validator.
      void initGame()
      Creates a new ChessBoard, and calls appropriate methods to generate 64 squares and 32 pieces; generates 2 players, and matches created pieces by colour to players; creates a new Validator, sets variable turn to 0.
      void turn(Piece p, Square s)
      Checks whether the players still have valid moves, then executes the player's move.

        Returns list of players.

      • findSquareByCoordinates

        public final Square findSquareByCoordinates(int x,
                                            int y)
        Finds square at coordinates x and y.
        Parameters:
        x - integer x coordinate
        y - integer y coordinate
        Returns:
        Square at coordinates x and y, or null if none is found

      • getValidator

        public final Validator getValidator()
        Returns validator.
        Returns:
        Validator

      • initGame

        public final void initGame()
        Creates a new ChessBoard, and calls appropriate methods to generate 64 squares and 32 pieces; generates 2 players, and matches created pieces by colour to players; creates a new Validator, sets variable turn to 0.

      • turn

        public final void turn(Piece p,
                       Square s)
        Checks whether the players still have valid moves, then executes the player's move.
        Parameters:
        p - Piece to be moved this turn
        s - Square for the piece to be moved to

      • enPassant

        public final void enPassant(Piece pawn,
                            Square to,
                            Square from)
        Helper function to determine when en passant is possible.
        Parameters:
        pawn - Piece that can be captured en passant
        to - Square piece pawn moved to
        from - Square piece pawn moved from

      • castle

        public final void castle(Square s)
        Handles castling when king is moved two squares to square s.
        Parameters:
        s - Square where king moved to

      • getEnded

        public final boolean getEnded()
        Returns boolean value for whether the game is finished.
        Returns:
        true if game has ended (neither player has valid moves left)

      • getTurn

        public String getTurn()
        Returns the String colour of the player whose turn it is.
        Returns:
        String for colour, w for white, b for black
